unit_learning_outcomes.description: Articulate methods of interviewing in counselling settings.
Show understanding of theories of counselling.
Demonstrate basic interviewing skills around a given problem.
Show working knowledge around the principles of ethical and professional practice.
Apply critical thinking and independent learning to solve problems related to counselling in the workplace.

enrolment_rules.description: (PSYC104 or PSYU1104 or PSYX104 or PSYX1104 PSYU1101 or PSYX1101) or (PSYC105 or PSYU1105 or PSYX105 or PSYX1105 or PSYU1102 or PSYX1102)

assessments.description: Short answer questions to be completed in 1 hour.
Students are required to submit a 600 word report outlining the strengths and weaknesses of counselling skills viewed in a video.
Students are required to critically evaluate, in 1500 words a therapy model.

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: The aim of this unit is to provide an introduction to contemporary approaches to counselling, and to teach basic interviewing skills for use in the workplace. There will be a balanced focus on theory, research and practice throughout the unit. Theoretical frameworks used in counselling will be reviewed, followed by a step-by-step introduction to conducting a counselling interview. Role-plays, demonstrations and case examples will be used to teach basic therapeutic skills. The unit will also involve self-reflective exercises, and will have a focus on ethical and professional practice.
data.title: Counselling Approaches and Principles
